contents.title: Arlo

productDetails.smallScreenDescription: Access your Arlo cameras with simple voice commands by using Amazon Alexa
productDetails.description:
With the Arlo Skill and Alexa, you can now access your Arlo cameras using voice commands. Using the Arlo Skill, you can ask Alexa to view the live feed from one of your cameras via your Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV or Fire tablets (Gen 7 and above). To take full advantage of these features, you need a supported and connected Arlo camera and an Echo Show, Echo Spot or any generation of Fire TV including second generation of Fire TV stick or Fire TV Edition smart TVs or generation seven Fire Tablets.

To get started, please make sure that your Arlo product is online and functioning properly.

Ask Amazon Alexa to enable the Arlo skill – “Alexa, enable Arlo skill” to get instructions in your Alexa app to link your Arlo account with your Alexa account.

OR

In the Alexa app, search for the Arlo Skill. Select the 'Enable Skill' button to link your Arlo account with your Alexa account.
Now, you can start using the Arlo skill.


Some example commands are:

“Alexa, show the front door camera.“
“Alexa, hide the front door camera.”
“Alexa, go home.”
“Alexa, stop.”

More information is available at http://www.arlo.com/alexa

Currently the Arlo Skill is supported on the following devices:
* Arlo Wire-free (Model VMC3030, VMS3x30)
* Arlo Q & Q Plus (Model VMC3040, VMC3040S)
* Arlo Pro (Model VMC4030, VMS4x30)
* Arlo Pro 2 (Model VMC4030p, VMS4x30p)
* Arlo Go (Model VML4030)
* Arlo Baby (Model ABC1000)

Compatible Amazon Alexa Devices:
* Echo Show
* Echo Spot
* Fire Tablets Generation 7th & above
* All generations of Fire TV
* Only second generations of Fire TV stick
* Fire TV Edition smart TVs

en-US.utterances: ["Alexa, show the backyard","Alexa, hide the front door","Alexa, show the garage"]
en-US.label: English (US)

contents.shortDescription: Access your Arlo cameras with simple voice commands by using Amazon Alexa

contents.title: Nest Camera

productDetails.smallScreenDescription: Stream your Nest camera video to your Echo Show or Fire TV.
productDetails.description:
Nest cameras are designed to help you look after your home and family – even when you’re away. Now you can control your Nest camera using Alexa with your Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV, Fire Stick or Fire Tablets (Gen7 & above).

To get started, select the 'Enable Skill' button to link your Nest account and discover your Nest cameras. For further assistance, please refer to http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home.

After linking your Nest account and discovering your Nest cameras in your Alexa account, you can start streaming live video to your Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV or Fire Tablets (Gen7 & above). To see your Nest camera feed on the device, just say commands* like:
- "Alexa, show the backyard camera"
- "Alexa, show the feed from the front door camera"

To stop your Nest camera from streaming video, you can say:
- "Alexa, hide the kids room camera"

Learn more about how Alexa works with Nest: https://nest.com/support/article/Learn-how-to-control-your-Nest-products-with-Amazon-Alexa

Compatible Nest Cameras:
- Dropcam
- Dropcam Pro
- Nest Cam Indoor
- Nest Cam Outdoor
- Nest Cam IQ

Compatible Amazon Alexa Devices:
- Echo Show
- Echo Spot
- All generations of Fire TV
- Second generations of Fire TV stick
- Fire TV Edition smart TVs
- Fire Tablets (generation 7 and above)

* When using this Skill, you need to specify the name of the desired camera. The name is equivalent to the location of where the camera was installed and can be found and configured in the Nest app. You can also add Nest cameras to new or existing groups in the Alexa app (http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home-groups).

en-AU.label: English (AU)

productDetails.description: Reuters Now is your 5 minute news briefing from Reuters TV. Updated around the clock by editorial teams on four continents, Reuters TV taps into a network of 2,500 journalists reporting from 200 locations worldwide. Straight from the source and made to fit your day.

contents.title: Weather

productDetails.smallScreenDescription: A brief update on today' weather conditions.
productDetails.description:
As part of your Flash Briefing, Alexa will provide a brief update on the current weather conditions, and the forecast for the day.

Forecast data provided by AccuWeather.

contents.title: Wink

productDetails.smallScreenDescription: With Amazon Alexa, Wink smart home users can use simple voice commands to control their Wink-compatible lights, locks, and Wink-enabled Nest Thermostats.
productDetails.description:
Say goodbye to fumbling with the light switch or door lock when you walk into a dark house with your hands full. Alexa makes it easier than ever to control your Wink-compatible lights, outlets, switches, locks, and thermostats.

Using Wink with Alexa is a flexible, convenient way to control your smart products. Here are some examples to get started:

“Alexa, is the front door locked?”
“Alexa, lock the front door.”
“Alexa, turn on the downstairs lamp.”
“Alexa, set living room light to 50%.”
"Alexa, set bedroom to warm white"

You can also use Alexa to control Wink Shortcuts that include only Wink-compatible lighting products. For example, say “Alexa, turn on Good Morning” and Alexa will turn on all the lights in your bedroom while you’re still cozy in bed.

Note: In order to use Amazon Alexa with Wink-compatible products, you’ll need a Wink account. Some products require the Wink Hub or Wink Hub 2. From there, getting started is easy:

1. Connect compatible products in the Wink app and set individual names for each product (bedroom lamp, kitchen light, front door, etc.).
2. Then, link your Wink account to Alexa within the Alexa mobile app (Settings > Skills > Type in & search “Wink” > Select “Wink” > Select “Enable”.)
3. From there, say “Alexa, discover new devices.” This can take up to 20 seconds.

You can also unlock locks using Wink + Alexa by creating a voice PIN in the Alexa app. Once set up, unlocking your smart lock is as easy as saying a four-digit voice code.

Visit http://echo.wink.com/ for a full list of Wink-compatible products that work with Alexa.

en-CA.utterances: ["Alexa, turn on the porch light","Alexa, set the living room to 20 degrees","Alexa, lock the front door"]
en-CA.label: English (CA)

en-US.utterances: ["Alexa, turn on the porch light","Alexa, set the living room to 68 degrees","Alexa, lock the front door"]
en-US.label: English (US)

utterances: Alexa, turn on the porch light
Alexa, set the living room to 68 degrees
contents.shortDescription: With Amazon Alexa, Wink smart home users can use simple voice commands to control their Wink-compatible lights, locks, and Wink-enabled Nest Thermostats.

contents.title: iSmartAlarm

productDetails.smallScreenDescription: iSmartAlarm is the leader in DIY smart home security with no fees or contracts. You can control your iSmartAlarm Smart Home Security System with this skill.
productDetails.description:
iSmartAlarm is the leader in DIY smart home security. The iSmartAlarm Home Security System is a self-monitored, self-managed, wireless system with no monthly fees and no contracts. Control and monitor your home with cameras, easy-to-install sensors, and an intuitive app. Visit www.ismartalarm.com to learn more.

You can arm and disarm your iSmartAlarm Smart Home Security System with this skill.

In order to use this skill, you will need to link your iSmartAlarm account to Alexa and have an iSmartAlarm Home Security System.

en-AU.utterances: ["Alexa, tell iSmartAlarm to arm my system","Alexa, tell iSmartAlarm to disarm my system","Alexa, tell iSmartAlarm to set mode to home"]
en-AU.label: English (AU)
